intro: Gerardia gatesii, commonly known as the Gates gerardia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Gerardia gatesii is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
